intro: Hieracium albiflorum, commonly known as the whiteflower hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal rosettes of leaves that are usually hairy and lobed. Its flowers are white to pale yellow, arranged in a single terminal head, and bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in woodland edges.
